selection_reason: This team stands out with the highest GW1 score (68.4) and 5GW estimate (352.2). The 4-4-2 formation provides excellent balance, with Salah as captain being a reliable choice. The midfield combination of Salah, Palmer, and Mbeumo offers both consistency and attacking returns. Chris Wood provides good value as a differential forward. The team structure allows for easy transfers if needed, and the 99.5 budget utilization is efficient.

The 4-3-3 formation with Salah, Isak, and Wood up front offers excellent attacking potential. Alexander Isak has been in great form for Newcastle and has favorable fixtures ahead. Cole Palmer's inclusion provides great value given his set-piece responsibilities at Chelsea. The balanced structure between attack and midfield reduces dependency on a single department for points. The slightly lower budget (99.0) suggests smart value picks.

BENCH2: David Mota Veiga Teixeira do Carmo (Nott'm Forest)
selection_reason: This team combines the best elements of attacking and defensive stability with a 4-4-2. Having both Salah and Isak provides strong captain options, while Mbeumo offers excellent value in midfield. The inclusion of Gvardiol from Man City adds clean sheet potential from a nailed-on defender. The team structure allows for easy adaptation to form changes and has good fixture coverage across different teams.
